Race.SpecificTitle: Constable -- Justice of the Peace Ward 2
PW-School Board -- 1% S&U Tax - School Board
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Sales Tax)

Summary:  1% sales and use tax of the Catahoula Parish School Board to provide funds for the payment of salary increases to be evenly divided among the employees of the said School Board, and for the payment of employee benefits.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish School Board of the Parish of Catahoula, State of Louisiana (the "Parish School Board"), under the provisions of Article VI, Section 29 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, and other constitutional and statutory authority, be authorized to levy and collect a tax of one percent (1%) (the "Tax") from and after January 1, 2009, upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption, and the storage for use or consumption of tangible personal property and on sales of services in Catahoula Parish, all as defined by law (an estimated $911,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), with the proceeds of the Tax (after paying the reasonable and necessary expenses of collecting and administering the Tax), to be dedicated and used to provide funds for the payment of salary increases to be evenly divided among the employees of the Parish School Board and for the payment of employee benefits?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Prot. District No.4 -- $30.00 Parcel Fee - BOC - 10 Yr.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District No. 4 Proposition

Summary:  10 year, $30.00 annual parcel fee in Fire Protection District No. 4 of the Parish of Catahoula for acquiring, constructing, maintaining and operating fire protection facilities and equipment, including paying the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes and salaries of firemen, and all purposes incidental thereto.
Race.FullText: Shall Fire Protection District No. 4 of the Parish of Catahoula, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy and collect an annual parcel fee of Thirty Dollars ($30) on each lot, subdivided portion of ground or individual tract upon which is located, either in whole or in part, a residential or commercial structure, regardless of the structures being occupied or unoccupied, for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2008 and ending with the year 2017 (an estimated $80,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of said parcel fee for an entire year), for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, maintaining and operating fire protection facilities and equipment, including paying the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes and salaries of firemen, and all purposes incidental thereto?
